name: 玛丽安·德尔·加列戈
name_full: 玛丽安·德尔·加列戈 Marianne del Gallego
introduction: Originally from the Philippines, Marianne started singing at the age of 5 and was in her first play by 10. In 1998, Marianne moved to Southern California and continued training and pursuing her love for musical theater. She spent some time on stage at the La Mirada Center for the Performing Arts in Los Angeles, California. The transition into film started in 2009 at the urging of a good friend and colleague. Marianne has starred in independent flicks like Point Man, Yellow Fever, Cornbread Cosa Nostra and recently The Vanished. Her television appearances include BET's: The Game, Unraveled and Homicide Hunter. She is well versed in the Spolin Method of Acting as coached by Jeanmarie Collins and is coached privately by Bob Luke of Bob Luke Studio, NYC. When not filming, Marianne can be found performing on stage in and around the southeast.
